column4: mmhh... I am having trouble finding my own access point and my neighbors', that is, in one scan I see one, then I see the other, then I see none for a couple of scans and this is driving me crazy. Maybe it is possible that something is causing a major interference around here ?
Sounds like a 2.4 ghz portable phone
Thay can really mess things up
maybe... in Germany ?
at 30 or 40 meters it would need to be a BIG generator
it is a construction, I haven't seen it but I can hear it.
there's one of those big things to break the streets... those nasty things... and I hear a steady humming... maybe it is just the engine of the thing.
if they shut it down at night or lunch do you see a difference?
I don't know... I'll have to wait till that. I've been having trouble to connect for some days, but I thought it was a problem with the wpa implementation.
SOme of those const generators are really really bad about RF control
You can give her a dd conmmand in a launcher...
why bs=2k?
Create ISO of CD Rom... dd if=/dev/cdrom of=/home/$USER/Desktop/file.iso bs=2k
a big block is faster but a small error will ruin a larger amount of data
why 2 and no other number?
man dd                     or make it 4
you are missing my point, but no problem.
HOw many times are you going to ask the same question and ignore the answer
I'm not ignoring the answers. There was no convincing answer. According to what I read, you can't really make iso images out of audio cds.
that was the first I saw that you were trying to do audio cd's
what?
YOu are correct, audio cds are not going to work like that
so, my question is, how do I save to HD an Audio CD for latter duplication (as an iso image doesn't seem to do it)?
